text: what's up everyone today is all about GameStop I want to run through a little more in depth some of the activity that we're seeing although it is generally Quiet on the Western Front this is a good time to collect different Baseline information for the product so that's what I want to do here because a lot of the conversations that I've had recently about GameStop since we had this pop back in like the middle of May was very centered on kind of really busy markets right like take a look at these volume bars it's just a lot going on there so we're in this little bit of a decline phase right and you can see a few things that I find interesting straight from a chart perspective when I look at the way price was behaving before we had the previous squeeze we can see that volume was real real quiet we saw a little bit of volume expand around earnings as per usual then we have this massive explosion in volume and that's just been coming down real real L let me get me out of the way so you can see right down here so the very first thing that comes to my mind is closely monitoring the volume and the way that the volume moves so what I like to do down here is to just kind of set let me grab this little line for you guys like kind price level so

text: that's just a recap on what I'm doing in here now in terms of my expectations again I'm a Trader I spend very little time making trades off of something I expect to happen before I see it starting to happen so what that means is for example I think GameStop is going to go up do I think it's going to go up tomorrow next week five weeks from now I I genuinely don't know now does that mean because I think it's going to go up that I'm going to start dogpiling money into the product no that's not how I trade and it's because I need it to start showing me that it wants to go in the correct direction because otherwise it's very easy to get wrapped up in periods like this in periods like this where something kind of goes sideways a little bit Trends down and then again from a Trader's perspective there's a massive opportunity cost to tying up a bunch of capital in something that's not really doing a whole lot for a long period of time it's a difficult way to make money again again in my business so what I'm primarily looking for here is it to start showing some different price Behavior this still just looks like consolidation to me we saw a bit of an update today it's up uh well Okay I lied to you it's not up I guess technically it's up come on man so
